main event: A round, bright green object was observed for 1-1.5 seconds in the night sky over Kansas City, Missouri on January 23, 1967.
interesting points: The object appeared to be about 1 inch in diameter when held at arm's length, or half the size of a full moon.
The object had a red spot in the center of the green glow.
The object appeared to be slightly descending as it traveled away and was estimated to be moving at 150-200 mph.
The description of the object is consistent with a meteor.
Weather conditions included a high, thin overcast sky and wind speeds up to 48 knots at higher altitudes.
sighted object: A round, bright green object with a red center
witnesses: 2 civilian witnesses, including a medical student
